item.title: Bill Gates: Read these 5 books this summer
item.description:
Bill Gates: Read these 5 books this summer

Bill Gates is a technology pioneer as founder of Microsoft. He is one of the world's richest people. And he now is focused on promoting education and health around the world. What does somebody like that recommend for summer reading? Here are five of his recommendations.

item.title: Alibaba's Jack Ma, China's second-richest man, visits Obama at the White House
item.description:
Alibaba's Jack Ma, China's second-richest man, visits Obama at the White House

(This post has been updated.) He's one of China's wealthiest and most influential men, but when Alibaba founder Jack Ma visited the White House on Tuesday, there was far less fanfare than for President Xi Jinping's state visit last fall. Reporters spotted Ma leaving the White House grounds with several aides and at least two security guards.

item.title: Apple Boss Tim Cook to Meet India's Selfie-Loving Prime Minister
item.description:
Apple Boss Tim Cook to Meet India's Selfie-Loving Prime Minister

Cook meets the 65- year old prime minister in New Delhi on Saturday, and will be hoping Modi's enthusiasm for phones can help Apple.

item.title: Jeff Bezos tells Amazon shareholders that it will open more physical bookstores
item.description:
Jeff Bezos tells Amazon shareholders that it will open more physical bookstores

Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos said during the company's annual shareholder meeting Tuesday that it wants to open more physical bookstores and add additional services to Amazon Prime. The e-commerce behemoth has never disclosed the precise amount of subscribers to Amazon Prime, which offers services like free two-day shipping and video/music streaming for a $99 annual fee.

item.title: Larry Ellison shares what dropping out of college and getting divorced taught him about success
item.description:
Larry Ellison shares what dropping out of college and getting divorced taught him about success

If self-made billionaire Larry Ellison hadn't trusted his instincts and dropped out of college, he may have never founded Oracle, one of the largest technology companies in the world.

item.title: Elon Musk has Wall Street wrapped around his little finger
item.description:
Elon Musk has Wall Street wrapped around his little finger

Tesla banked almost $1.5 billion last week, selling new shares - to fund the launch of its now hotly anticipated Model 3 - at a healthy $215 per share. The ease with which it raised the funds (and the fact that its shares rose 5% the week of the sale), shows how easily Tesla is able to use Wall Street to do its bidding.

item.title: Richard Branson says EU exit would be 'saddest day' for Britain
item.description:
Richard Branson says EU exit would be 'saddest day' for Britain

Virgin boss Sir Richard Branson has warned that a vote for Britain to leave the European Union could see "massive numbers of routes" taken away from low-cost airlines operating from the UK, as well as onerous costs in tax and extra bureaucracy.

item.title: Public Speaking Tips From Sir Richard Branson
item.description:
Public Speaking Tips From Sir Richard Branson

It's a book I recently read. In the book, Sir Richard Branson devotes quite a few pages to the art of public speaking. And I must say. I took quite a few public speaking courses in college. And this book would have probably allowed me to test out of many of them.

item.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook talks about his plan to open Apple stores and sell used iPhones in India
item.description:
Apple CEO Tim Cook talks about his plan to open Apple stores and sell used iPhones in India

Watch his TV interview in Android country.
